tool.title: Self-consistent Band Structure Lab
tool.about:
This is a tool developed for obtaining Band-Structure of various materials used in different situations like bulk material, in ultra thin bodies, and in nanowires. This tool provides a way to test the effect of confinement, real edges and applied biases on the band structure of the material. User can simulate the electrostatics of nanowires and UTBs and obtain the important bandstructure effects on the CV curves.This tool has been developed at Purdue University, West Lafayette, USA. -- Material Available semiconductor materials that can be simulated in the tool.
--Credits NCN, Purdue University
--Powered by nanoHUB.org
--Developers: Neophytos Neophytou, Abhijeet Paul, Mathieu Luiseir and Raseong Kim at Purdue University.
tool.name: Workspace (800x600)

about.label: Geometry
about.description: Choose the structure that you want to simulate. At the nano scale, the geometry of the physical structure will influence the band structure.

about.label: Job type
about.description: The list of simulations that can be done

about.label: Job Type
about.description: The kind of simulation you are interested in.

about.label: Calculate the UTB Band-structure
about.description: Calculation of band-structure in the X-Yplane in the wire(Fixed EK calculation).

about.label: Calculate the UTB Band-Structure Self consistently
about.description: Band structure calculation is dene self-consistently under a gate and drain bias.

about.label: Dimension
about.description: Dimension of the nanostructure

about.label: Thickness Lz
about.description: Thickness of the channel region in the z-direction.

about.label: Top Gate Oxide Thickness (tox1)
about.description: Thickness of the top oxide region in the z-direction.

about.label: Bottom Gate Oxide Thickness (tox2)
about.description: Thickness of the bottom oxide region in the z-direction.

about.label: Crystal Info
about.description: Select the Transport and Crystal growth direction. Dispaersion and transport properties are calculated according to these directions.

about.label: Crystal growth direction (Z)
about.description: Orient the material so that this direction of the unit cell is oriented in the z-direction.
Vector along the x-direction of the unit cell.
Vector along the diagonal of the x-y face of the unit cell.
Vector along the diagonal of the unit cell.

about.label: Transport direction (x)
about.description: Orient the material so that this direction of the unit cell is oriented in the x-direction (direction where electrons flow through the channel).
Vector along the y-direction of the unit cell.
Vector along the diagonal of the y-z face of the unit cell.

about.label: Transport direction (x)
about.description: Orient the material so that this direction of the unit cell is oriented in the x-direction (direction where electrons flow through the channel).
Vector along the z-direction of the unit cell.
Vector outside the unit cell, in the x-y plane, perpendicular to (110).

about.label: Transport direction (x)
about.description: Orient the material so that this direction of the unit cell is oriented in the x-direction (direction where electrons flow through the channel).
Vector outside the unit cell, in the x-y plane, perpendicular to (110).
Vector outside the unit cell, similar to (111) but pointing downward in z.

about.label: Material
about.description: Inner core is made using this semiconductor material.

about.label: Si
about.description: Silicon, bulk values EG = 1.12eV, Ec = 1.12eV, Ev = 0.0eV

about.label: GaAs
about.description: Galium Arsenide, bulk values EG = 1.424eV, Ec = 1.424eV, Ev = 0.0eV

about.label: InAs
about.description: Indium Arsenide, bulk values EG = 0.3714eV, Ec = 0.5957eV, Ev = 0.2243eV

about.label: Ge
about.description: Germanium, bulk values EG = 0.678eV, Ec = 1.448eV, Ev = 0.77eV

about.label: Tight Binding Model
about.description: Select the basis set for Tight Binding.

about.label: sp3d5s*
about.description: 10 orbital model

about.label: sp3s*
about.description: 5 orbital model

about.label: Spin-Orbit Coupling
about.description: Include the effects of spin-orbit coupling on band structure.

about.label: Dangling Bond Energy
about.description: This accounts for the effects of dangling bonds on the surface of the structure. It applies only when the geometry is constrained and therefore the dangling bonds are close to the transport region.

about.label: Select the type of job
about.description: You can run the simple band-structure analysis or strain sweep.

about.label: Explore bands along
about.description:
Compute energy bands along this direction in k-space.
NOTE: If there is no strain, the various paths from Gamma->X are equivalent. The same is true for Gamma->L. But when strain is applied, the bands along these paths can be different.

about.label: Full domain
about.description: Explore a path through k-space along L->Gamma->X->U->K->X.

about.label: Gamma -> X along [100]
about.description: Explore a path through k-space along Gamma->X in the [100] direction.

about.label: Gamma -> X along [010]
about.description: Explore a path through k-space along Gamma->X in the [010] direction.

about.label: Gamma -> X along [001]
about.description: Explore a path through k-space along Gamma->X in the [001] direction.

about.label: Gamma -> L along [111]
about.description: Explore a path through k-space along Gamma->L in the [111] direction.

about.label: Gamma -> L along [-111]
about.description: Explore a path through k-space along Gamma->L in the [-111] direction.

about.label: Gamma -> L along [1-11]
about.description: Explore a path through k-space along Gamma->L in the [1-11] direction.

about.label: Gamma -> L along [11-1]
about.description: Explore a path through k-space along Gamma->L in the [11-1] direction.

about.label: Show 3D Brillouin Zone
about.description: Show the 3D Brillouin Zone

about.label: Conduction Band
about.description: Show the full 3D CB

about.label: Valence Band (HH,LH,SOH)
about.description: show the full 3D VB

about.label: Conduction and Valence Bands
about.description: Show both 3D CB and VB(HH,LH,SOH)

about.label: Energy band from bottom of CB (meV):
Energy band from top of VB (meV):
Energy band from bottom of CB (meV):
Energy band from top of VB (meV):

about.description: the bands on which strain analysis for effective mass will be done.

about.label: Select the direction to explore for Gamma Valley
Direction :
about.description: Along longitudinal and transverse direction strain will change the effective masses. Effective mass becomes anisotropic.

about.label: Select the valance band :
about.description: Effect of strain on this band will be observed .

about.label: Explore in UTB:
about.description: Compute these energy bands.

about.label: Conduction bands
about.description: Compute only bands above the energy gap.

about.label: Valence bands
about.description: Compute only bands below the energy gap.

about.label: along
about.description:
Compute energy bands along this direction in k-space.
NOTE: If there is no strain, the various paths from Gamma->X are equivalent. The same is true for Gamma->L. But when strain is applied, the bands along these paths can be different.

about.label: Gamma->X along [100]
about.description: Explore a path through k-apce along Gamma->X in the [100] direction.

about.label: Gamma->X along [010]
about.description: Explore a path through k-space along Gamma->X in the [010] direction.

about.label: Gamma->L along [110]
about.description: Explore a path through k-space along [110] direction.

about.label: Gamma->L along [1-10]
about.description: Explore a path through k-space along [1-10] direction.

about.label: Full domain
about.description:
Explore inside the 2-dimensional 1st Brillouin zone.
NOTE: It takes long time to get the E-k result with this option.

about.label: Full domain
about.description: Entire domain is selected

about.label: Number of bands
about.description: Limit the number of bands computed to this number on the conduction or valence side of the gap. The more bands you include, the longer the calculation.

about.label: Number of k-points
about.description:
Specify the number of k-points in the given k-domain.
EXAMPLE: When the "Gamma->X(L)" option is chosen above, this value is used to divide k-points from (0,0,0) to 2pi/a(1,1,1) or 2pi/a(0.5,0,5,0.5). When the "Full domain" option is selected, this number is used to generate k-vectors from -2pi/a to 2pi/a.

about.label: Explore:
about.description: Compute these energy bands.

about.label: Conduction bands
about.description: Compute only bands above the energy gap.

about.label: Valence bands
about.description: Compute only bands below the energy gap.These are the filled states in the semiconductor.

about.label: Conduction and Valence bands
about.description: Compute both type of bands in the semiconductor nanowire.

about.label: Number of bands
about.description: Limit the number of bands computed to this number on the conduction or valence side of the gap. The more bands you include, the longer the calculation.

about.label: Number of k-points
about.description: Specify the number of k-points from -2pi/a to 2pi/a.

about.label: Explore
about.description: Compute these energy bands.

about.label: Conduction bands
about.description: Compute only bands above the energy gap.

about.label: Valence bands
about.description: Compute only bands below the energy gap.

about.label: Number of bands
about.description: Limit the number of bands computed to this number on the conduction or valence side of the gap. The more bands you include, the longer the calculation.

about.label: Number of k-points
about.description: Specify the number of k-points from -2pi/a to 2pi/a.

about.label: Strain model
about.description: Choose a model for the strain applied to your structure.

about.label: Biaxial (strain in X,Y)
about.description: Strain is applied in two directions, X and Y.

about.label: Hydrostatic (strain in X,Y,Z)
about.description: Strain is applied uniformly in all directions.

about.label: Free choice
about.description: Choose your own values for strain in X, Y, and Z directions.

about.label: None
about.description: No strain applied to material.

about.label: Strain direction
about.description: Choose the strain direction from among the high-symmetry directions.
Vector along the z-direction of the unit cell.
Vector along the diagonal of the x-y face of the unit cell.
Vector along the diagonal of the unit cell.

about.label: Epsilon
about.description: This is the amount of strain applied, as a fraction--typically a small fraction. If negative, it is a compressive strain, and if positive, an expansive strain.

about.label: Epsilon(x)
about.description: This is the amount of strain applied in the x-direction, as a fraction--typically a small fraction. If negative, it is a compressive strain, and if positive, an expansive strain.

about.label: Epsilon(y)
about.description: This is the amount of strain applied in the y-direction, as a fraction--typically a small fraction. If negative, it is a compressive strain, and if positive, an expansive strain.

about.label: Epsilon(z)
about.description: This is the amount of strain applied in the z-direction, as a fraction--typically a small fraction. If negative, it is a compressive strain, and if positive, an expansive strain.

about.label: Strain model
about.description: Choose a model for the strain applied to your structure.

about.label: Biaxial (strain in X,Y)
about.description: Strain is applied in two directions, X and Y.

about.label: Hydrostatic (strain in X,Y,Z)
about.description: Strain is applied uniformly in all directions.

about.label: Strain direction
about.description: Choose the strain direction from among the high-symmetry directions.
Vector along the z-direction of the unit cell.
Vector along the diagonal of the x-y face of the unit cell.
Vector along the diagonal of the unit cell.

about.label: Initial Strain(Exx):
about.description: Initial strain along direction.

about.label: Final Strain(Exx):
about.description: Initial strain along direction.

about.label: Number of Points(num):
about.description: Initial strain along direction.

about.label: Inputs for Self Consistent EK Calculation
Fermi Level(V) :
about.description: Set the fermi-level for the source, this indicates the doping in the source. This value is set with respect to the bulk conduction band minima. So set it accordingly to do the simulations.

about.label: Electron Temperature(T) :
about.description: The temperature at which the simulation is done. This controls the spreading of Fermi-Dirac function which in turn controls the filling of bands in the nanodevice.

about.label: Inputs for Self Consistent EK Calculation
Fermi Level(V) :
about.description: Set the fermi-level for the source, this indicates the doping in the source. This value is set with respect to the bulk conduction band minima. So set it accordingly to do the simulations.

about.label: Electron Temperature(T) :
about.description: The temperature at which the simulation is done. This controls the spreading of Fermi-Dirac function which in turn controls the filling of bands in the nanodevice.

about.label: Inputs for CV Calculation in NW
Fermi Level(V) :
about.description: Set the fermi-level for the source, this indicates the doping in the source. This value is set with respect to the bulk conduction band minima. So set it accordingly to do the simulations.

about.label: Electron Temperature(T) :
about.description: The temperature at which the simulation is done. This controls the spreading of Fermi-Dirac function which in turn controls the filling of bands in the nanodevice.

about.label: Inputs for CV Calculation in UTB
Fermi Level(V) :
about.description: Set the fermi-level for the source, this indicates the doping in the source. This value is set with respect to the bulk conduction band minima. So set it accordingly to do the simulations.

about.label: Electron Temperature(T) :
about.description: The temperature at which the simulation is done. This controls the spreading of Fermi-Dirac function which in turn controls the filling of bands in the nanodevice.

about.label: Select the back gate configuration
about.description: How the back gate voltage varies with respect to the front gate voltage
